alert.note: Alert for Butler; Harvey; Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 8:29PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Harvey, northwestern Butler and Marion Counties through 900 PM CST... At 829 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tampa to near Whitewater. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Marion, Peabody, Whitewater, Florence, Walton, Elbing, Burns, Lincolnville, Ramona, Durham, Tampa, Lost Springs, Newton Airport, Marion Lake and Pilsen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for south central, central and east central Kansas.
